Based on the symptoms you have described, it sounds like your cat may be suffering from an ear mite infestation.
Ear mites, also known as Otodectes cynotis, are tiny, spider-like parasites that live in the ear canal of cats. They are highly contagious and can be easily transmitted from one cat to another through close contact

If it does, I can assure that your cat’s ear is in a good condition. If you have doubt regarding the issue, you can check on vet specialist. We have services that include finding nearest veterinary clinics near you. Check it out on our other services.

Hair loss might be the cause of it. Can you tell me the shape of the hair loss patches?
[Type and send the option]
-Ring shape
-Scatter shape

Based on the symptoms you've described, it sounds like your cat may be suffering from a ringworm infection. Ringworm, also known as dermatophytosis, is a fungal infection that affects the skin of cats. The fungus that causes ringworm infects the hair shafts and hair follicles of the affected area, causing hair loss and ring-shaped patches around the skin. The affected areas may also be scaly, red and inflamed
If you have doubt regarding the issue, you can check on vet specialist. We have services that include finding nearest veterinary clinics near you. Check it out on our other services.

Hmm..based on your symptoms, it sounds like your cat may be suffering from a ‘Feline Leprosy’.
Feline leprosy, also known as Mycobacterium leprae infection, is a bacterial infection that affects cats. It is caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium leprae, which is closely related to the bacterium that causes leprosy in humans.
